questions.question: The value of count at the end of execution of the following C program is:
questions.code:
int incr(int i){ static int count = 0; count = count + i; return count; }
int main(){ int i,j; for(i=0;i<=4;i++) j=incr(i); }

questions.question: In the C language:

options.A: At most one activation record exists
options.B: Number of activation records depends on function calls
options.C: Visibility of globals depends on call sequence

questions.question: The output of the following C program is:
questions.code:
char p[20]; char *s="string"; int i,len=strlen(s);
for(i=0;i<len;i++) p[i]=s[len-i-1]; p[len]='\0'; printf("%s",p);

questions.question: If the function prototype is deleted, the program will show:
Choose the correct option so that the program prints an input string in reverse order.
questions.code: void reverse(){ int c; if((c=getchar())!='\n') reverse(); putchar(c); }

questions.question: What output is produced by the following program?
questions.code: static int a=1; void f(){ static int a=2; int b=1; a+=++b; printf("%d %d",a,b);} int main(){ f(); a++; f(); printf("%d",a); }

questions.question: Which function call will NOT result in a type checking error?
questions.code:
void f(int, short);
int i=100; short s=12; short *p=&s;

questions.question: Output of the following C program is:
questions.code: int total(int v){ static int c=0; while(v){ c+=v&1; v>>=1;} return c;} int main(){ int x=0,i=5; for(;i>0;i--) x+=total(i); printf("%d",x);}

questions.question: What value is printed?
questions.code: int r(){ static int n=7; return n--; } int main(){ for(r();r();r()) printf("%d",r()); }

questions.question: The output of the following program is:
Which option is correct?
questions.code: int i=0,j,count=0; for(j=-3;j<=3;j++) if((j>=0)&&(i++)) count+=j; count+=i; printf("%d",count);

questions.question: What is printed by the following program?
questions.code: char a='P',b='x'; char c=(a&b)+'*'; char d=(a|b)-'-'; char e=(a^b)+'+'; printf("%c %c %c",c,d,e);

questions.question: The integer value printed by the program is:
questions.code: static int x=1; int f(){ x++; return x;} int main(){ int a=f(); int b=f()+a; printf("%d",a+b); }

questions.question: Which statement is correct?
questions.code: int a=6,b=0; while(a<10){ a=a/12+1; a+=b;} printf("%d",a);

questions.question: What is the output?
questions.code: double a[2]={20.0,25.0}; double *p=a,*q=p+1; printf("%d,%d",(int)(q-p),(int)(*q-*p));

questions.question: The value returned by the function is:
questions.code: unsigned long int fun(unsigned long int n){ unsigned long int i,j=0,sum=0; for(i=n;i>1;i=i/2) j++; for(;j>1;j=j/2) sum++; return sum; }

questions.question: The number of times sum is printed is:
questions.code: float sum=0,j=1,i=2; while(i/j>0.0625){ j=j+j; sum=sum+i/j; printf("%f",sum); }

questions.question: The output of the program is:
questions.code: void printlength(char *s,char *t){ unsigned int c=0; int len=((strlen(s)-strlen(t))>c)?strlen(s):strlen(t); printf("%d",len);} int main(){ char *x="abc",*y="defgh"; printlength(x,y); }

questions.question: What is printed by the following program?
What is the output of the following program?
questions.code: int arr[4][5]; int i,j; for(i=0;i<4;i++) for(j=0;j<5;j++) arr[i][j]=10*i+j; printf("%d",*(arr[1]+9));

questions.question: What is the output of the following program?
questions.code: int funcg(int x){ static int y=10; y++; return y+x;} int funcf(int x){ return funcg(x);} int main(){ int x=5,y=10,c; for(c=1;c<=2;c++){ y+=funcf(x)+funcg(x); printf("%d",y);} }

questions.question: The output of the following program is:
What is the output of the program?
questions.code: char* c="GATECSIT2017"; printf("%d",(int)strlen(c+2[c]-6[c]-1));

questions.question: What is printed by the program?
questions.code: char a='P',b='x'; char c=(a&b)+'*'; printf("%c",c);
